name: Grand Teton National Park
description: Soaring over a landscape rich with wildlife, pristine lakes, and majestic alpine vistas, the Teton Range stands as a testament to generations of stewards. For over 11,000 years, communities have thrived in the valley known as Jackson Hole, turning these mountains into more than just peaks—they embody imagination and enduring human connection.
shortDescription: Soaring over a landscape rich with wildlife, pristine lakes, and majestic alpine vistas, the Teton Range stands as a testament to generations of stewards. For over 11,000 years, communities have thriv...

operatingHours.description: Visitors may enter the park at any time, but visitor services and motor vehicle access vary throughout the year.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: Park entrance fee for 7 days for a private, non-commercial vehicle.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: Park entrance fee for 7 days for each visitor 16 years and older entering by foot, bicycle, ski, etc.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Sedan
fees.description:
A commercial tour is defined as consisting of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. 

The cost is $25 + $20 per person. Pass is good for seven days as long as it's the same passenger group.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Van
fees.description:
Based upon the total capacity of a vehicle that can carry 7-15 passengers, regardless of the actual number of passengers. 

A commercial tour is defined as consisting of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. 

Pass is good for seven days as long as it's the same passenger group.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Mini-bus
fees.description:
Based upon the total capacity of a vehicle that can carry 16-25 passengers, regardless of the actual number of passengers. 

A commercial tour is defined as consisting of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. 

Pass is good for seven days as long as it's the same passenger group.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Motor Coach
fees.description:
Based upon the total capacity of a vehicle that can carry 26 or more passengers, regardless of the actual number of passengers. 

A commercial tour is defined as consisting of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced, or sold for leisure or recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service. 

Pass is good for seven days as long as it's the same passenger group.

fees.title: Entrance - Education/Academic Groups
fees.description: Schools or other bona fide educational institutions (accredited, officially recognized, or tax exempt for educational purposes) may request an educational fee waiver. The fee waiver will allow qualifying groups free entry into the park for educational or scientific purposes. Prior approval required before entry to park. See additional Education Fee Waiver page.

fees.title: Nonresident
fees.description: Each non-US resident aged 16 and older visiting Grand Teton National Park must pay a $100 nonresident fee (in addition to the standard entrance fee), unless admitted with an Annual or America the Beautiful Pass. This includes nonresidents entering as part of a commercial tour group, commercial use authorization (CUA) group, or concessioner tour group.

climate.weatherDescription: Grand Teton National Park has long, cold winters—snow and frost are possible any month. April, May, & June - Mild days and cool nights alternate with rain and snow. July & August - Warm days and cool nights prevail, with afternoon thundershowers common. September, October, & November - Sunny days and cold nights alternate with rain and occasional snowstorms. December to April - Between storms the days are sunny and nights are frigid. Snow blankets the mountains and valley.

images.title: North Fork Cascade Canyon
images.altText: Backpackers in North Fork Cascade Canyon, Grand Teton behind
images.caption: Backpackers in North Fork Cascade Canyon approaching Paintbrush Divide.

images.title: Winter Sunrise on the Teton Range
images.altText: Winter sunrise on snow-covered Teton Range
images.caption: Winter sunrise on snow-covered Teton Range

images.title: Grizzly Bear
images.altText: Grizzly bear running through dry grass with shrubs behind
images.caption: Grizzly bears are found throughout Grand Teton National Park

images.title: Lake Solitude with the Cathedral Group
images.altText: Lake Solitude with the high Teton Peaks beyond during summer
images.caption: Lake Solitude is a favorite hiking destination in the park.

images.title: Oxbow Bend and Mount Moran
images.altText: Oxbow Bend on the Snake River during fall with golden aspens and Mount Moran in the background.
images.caption: Mount Moran at Oxbow Bend is a classic autumn view.

images.title: Visitors at the Snake River Overlook
images.altText: Mother in pink shirt, child in orange shirt, the Snake River below and the Teton Range beyond.
images.caption: The Snake River Overlook is a where Ansel Adams took his iconic image of the Teton Range.

images.title: John Moulton Barn at Mormon Row
images.altText: Historic Moulton Barn with visitors and the Teton Range beyond.
images.caption: Two Moulton brothers built adjacent icon barns on Mormon Row. John's barn is pictured. T.A., his brother, built a barn just to the south.

images.title: American Pika (Ochotona princeps)
images.altText: American Pika perched on a granite boulder
images.caption: American Pika live in rockfall areas.

images.title: Moose
images.altText: Bull moose with large antlers walking through fall grasses
images.caption: In the fall, bull moose antlers have lost their velvet readying for the rut.

images.title: Schwabacher Landing
images.altText: beaver pond at Schwabacher landing reflecting the Teton Range in early summer
images.caption: The beaver ponds near Schwabacher Landing can produce beautiful reflections of the Teton Range.
